text: Human nature is such that monogamy is a really hard thing to achieve.
author: Sienna Miller

text: Whatsoever is contrary to nature is contrary to reason, and whatsoever is contrary to reason is absurd.
author: Baruch Spinoza

text: A committee is organic rather than mechanical in its nature: it is not a structure but a plant. It takes root and grows, it flowers, wilts, and dies, scattering the seed from which other committees will bloom in their turn.
author: C. Northcote Parkinson

text: Nothing in the universe is contingent, but all things are conditioned to exist and operate in a particular manner by the necessity of the divine nature.
author: Baruch Spinoza

text: Nature is something outside our body, but the mind is within us.
author: Bhumibol Adulyadej
